cool_down_sequence.title: Grounding — Feel Your Body
cool_down_sequence.gesture: Place both feet flat on the floor, press your toes down slightly, and feel the ground supporting you.
cool_down_sequence.primary_phrase: I am here, right now. I am safe in my space.

cool_down_sequence.title: Reclaiming Your Worth
cool_down_sequence.gesture: Place one hand gently on your chest over your heart. Feel your heartbeat.
cool_down_sequence.primary_phrase: My heart is still kind. I spoke with care, and that matters.

cool_down_sequence.title: Releasing Their Energy
cool_down_sequence.gesture: With your other hand, sweep outward as if brushing away dust or smoke from your body.
cool_down_sequence.primary_phrase: I let go of what isn’t mine to carry.

cool_down_sequence.title: Resetting Your Breath
cool_down_sequence.gesture: Breathe in slowly through your nose, relax your shoulders, and exhale through your mouth.
cool_down_sequence.primary_phrase: I breathe in peace… I breathe out pain.

cool_down_sequence.title: Self-Compassion and Closure
cool_down_sequence.gesture: Keep your hand on your chest or wrap your arms around yourself in a light hug.
cool_down_sequence.primary_phrase: That was hard, and I’m proud of how I handled it. I choose quiet now. I’m taking care of me.

grounding_safety: I am safe now. I’m allowed to step away.
Their reaction is over there; my calm is over here.
I can breathe again. My body doesn’t have to keep fighting.
This moment will pass — I’ve gotten through worse.
self_worth_detachment: Their anger isn’t proof I did something wrong.
I spoke from honesty and care — that’s all I can control.
It’s okay if they don’t understand me; I still understand myself.
I am worthy of respect even when others don’t show it.
I don’t need to earn peace by explaining myself.
release_letgo: I don’t have to carry their words with me.
That conversation belongs to the past now.
I can let the storm pass without joining it.
I release the guilt that isn’t mine.
I choose quiet over chaos right now.
recentering_selfcompassion: That hurt, and I can comfort myself gently.
I’m learning new ways to protect my peace.
I’m proud of myself for recognizing the pattern.
I deserve kind communication — even from myself.
Every time I step away instead of explode, I’m healing.
